prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom. The height of the cylinder is approximately three times its diameter and it has a smooth surface. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.2344, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a circle on the sketch with center at (0.1406, 0.1406) and radius 0.1406. 4. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.2812. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.0703 towards the normal to generate the 3D model. **Part 2: Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides of the prism are parallel to each other. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.1406, 0.0703. 2. Draw the first 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. * Create a line from (0.0, 0.1406) to (0.2344, 0.002). * Create a line from (0.2344, 0.002) to (0.375, 0.001). * Create a line from (0.375, 0.001) to (0.5156, 0.0). * Create a line from (0.5156, 0.0) to (0.75, 0.1406). * Create a line from (0.75, 0.1406) to (0.75, 0.2344). * Create a line from (0.75, 0.2344) to (0.0, 0.2344). * Create a line from (0.0, 0.2344) to (0.0, 0.1406) to close the loop. 3. Draw a second 2D sketch on the Y-Z plane of the coordinate system. * Create a line from (0.375, 0.0) to (0.5156, 0.0). * Create a line from (0.5156, 0.0) to (0.375, 0.001). * Create a line from (0.375, 0.001) to (0.375, 0.0) to close the loop. 4. Scale both 2D sketches by 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketches into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector. 6. Extrude the first 2D sketch by 0.1406 towards the normal and the second 2D sketch by the same distance opposite to the normal to generate the 3D model.</description>
